metadata.title: CVE-2011-3092 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The regex implementation in Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before19.0.1084.46, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalidwrite operation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via unknownvectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-3092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5
chromium-browser-l10n - 20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5
chromium-chromedriver - 20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
chromium-browser package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5').
